alert.note: Alert for Grand; San Juan (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 17 at 4:42PM MDT until August 17 at 7:45PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: The National Weather Service in Grand Junction has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Grand County in east central Utah... Northeastern San Juan County in southeastern Utah... * Until 745 PM MDT. * At 442 PM MDT, Emergency management reported water spilling over Powerhouse Dam on Mill Creek. Water in the basin is due to heavy rainfall estimated between 0.5 and 0.8 inches. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Runoff from heavy rainfall and water spilling over Powerhouse Dam. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Moab. This includes the following streams and drainages... Mill Creek and North Fork Mill Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
